descript.abstract: Amtrak Stations database is a point theme representing Amtrak intercity railroad passenger terminals in the United States and Canada. Attribute data include services and passenger amenities provided at the station.
descript.purpose: The data set provides location and attribute information for use in national and regional cartographic and network analysis applications.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.5.1450

dataqual.logic: All point records are represented by a single coordinate pair and a unique feature identifier; the Amtrak Station Code (stored in the STNCODE field). Attribute data can be matched to specific point records using this identifier.
dataqual.complete: The database includes all Amtrak railroad and thruway bus stations listed in the Amtrak timetables mentioned above.

citeinfo.title: Amtrak Spring/Summer National and Summer/Fall Northeast Timetables

srcinfo.srccontr: Passenger station addresses and characteristic attributes

procstep.procdesc: Each Amtrak railroad or thruway bus station identified in the Amtrak Timetables was initially geocoded based on its street address and ZIP Code, using the geocoding procedures in ESRI software and the TIGER/Line(TM) 1995 street centerline databases. Stations with ambiguous street addresses were then located using a combination of geographic cues, including location of nearest railroad tracks, location of Standard Point Location Code (SPLC) place names, location of Census Named Places, and commercial road atlases. Stations with no street address and stations located in Canada were manually located based on place name and location of nearest railroad service.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: City and State of the station
Street address of the station, if app.
Name of city where station is located
State railroad abbreviation which follows the Postal abbreviation
The latitude of the point expressed as a signed real number. This value is in decimal degrees with negative values indicating South latitude and positive values indicating North latitude.
The longitude of the point expressed as a signed real number. This value is in decimal degrees with negative values indicating West longitude and positive values indicating East longitude.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute for Standards and Technology (NIST).

attr.attrdef: The VERSION is a 2-digit number that will be incremented for all records in the database whenever a new release is distributed.

cntperp.cntorg: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

onlinopt.accinstr: NTAD is available for download at www.bts.gov/programs/geographic_information_services. The NTAD DVD can also be ordered from the online bookstore at www.bts.gov.

stdorder.ordering: Call 202-366-DATA, or E-mail (answers@bts.gov) RITA/BTS to request the National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2008 DVD. This and other RITA/BTS products may be ordered from the RITA/BTS Internet website http://www.bts.gov/programs/geographic_information_services/.

distinfo.techpreq: Software that can process GIS files.

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
